excerpt: Tiny monastery & Corfu emblem in the middle of a bay, with views of airport traffic overhead.
detail_description: The Holy Monastery of Panagia Vlacherna is a charming and iconic site located in the middle of a bay in Corfu. It offers stunning views of airport traffic overhead and is connected to the mainland by a footbridge. The monastery's picturesque setting makes it a must-visit attraction on any trip to Corfu. While its interior details remain unknown, the exterior exudes charm and beauty, making it an essential stop for visitors exploring the island's rich cultural and natural attractions.
name: Holy Monastery of Panagia Vlacherna

detail_description: Palaia Poli Kerkiras, also known as the Old Town of Corfu, is a charming and historic area with narrow cobblestone streets and colorful buildings. The old fortress adds to the area's character, offering stunning views of the sea and surrounding landscapes. Visitors can explore the well-preserved Venetian architecture, browse through local shops, or relax at one of the cozy cafes.
name: Old Town of Corfu

excerpt: Tiny, tree-covered Greek island featuring a medieval-era Byzantine chapel, accessible by boat.
detail_description: Pontikonisi, affectionately known as Mouse Island, is a charming little gem nestled in the lush greenery of Greece. This enchanting isle, accessible by a short boat ride from Kanoni, boasts an intriguing medieval Byzantine chapel that dates back to the 11th century. The island's name comes from its mouse-like shape when viewed from above and is adorned with tall cypress trees and vibrant flora that create a picturesque setting.
name: Pontikonisi

excerpt: Corfu Town is the capital of the Greek island of Corfu, in the Ionian Sea. It’s known for its cobblestone streets and pastel-colored Venetian architecture. To the west, the Venetian-built New Fortress has a network of tunnels underneath and views over the harbor. The 15th-century Old Fortress overlooks the town from the east and features a small chapel and mosaics. The Esplanade is a landscaped park near the water.
detail_description: Corfu, the capital of the Greek island of Corfu, is a charming destination with cobblestone streets and pastel-colored Venetian architecture. The town boasts two impressive fortresses - the New Fortress to the west and the Old Fortress to the east, both offering stunning views. The Esplanade, a beautiful park near the water, provides a relaxing escape.
name: Corfu

excerpt: Scenic ruins of an ancient fort, with artifacts on display, a seating area & a church.
detail_description: The Old Fortress of Corfu is a must-see historic site located near the island's capital. It consists of scenic ruins, artifacts on display, a seating area, and a beautiful church. Easter is an especially festive time to visit, with unique church services and processions. The dropping of colorful clay pots from balconies in the Old Town on Saturday morning is a tradition not to be missed.
name: Old Fortress

excerpt: Commanding 16th-century Greek Orthodox church known for its soaring bell tower & painted ceiling.
detail_description: The Holy Church of Saint Spyridon is a 16th-century Greek Orthodox church located in Corfu, known for its impressive bell tower and painted ceiling. It houses the relics of St. Spyridon, brought to Corfu City from Constantinople in the 15th century. The church's Renaissance bell tower is the tallest in the Ionian Islands, and it features a distinctive red dome. The interior boasts a marble iconostasis with classical lines, Corinthian columns, and paintings.
name: Holy Church of Saint Spyridon

excerpt: Both the old & new ports of the city can be seen from this city square, one of Greece's largest.
detail_description: Spianada Square, also known as the Esplanade, is a prominent city square in Corfu, Greece. It offers stunning views of both the old and new ports of the city. The square is situated between the edge of Corfu's old town and the old fortress on the coast. Visitors can take leisurely strolls in the park or relax at one of its many cafes while enjoying some people-watching.
name: Spianada Square

detail_description: Corfu International Airport, also known as Ioannis Kapodistrias Airport, is located just 3km south of Corfu Town and serves both domestic and international flights. The airport offers a spectacular view upon landing, making it worth booking a window seat for the experience. Travelers can easily reach the heart of Corfu Town within minutes by taking the airport bus upon arrival.
name: Corfu International Airport "Ioannis Kapodistrias"

detail_description: The Corfu mountain trail offers a fantastic opportunity to explore the stunning scenery, nature, and historical landmarks of the island. This 220-kilometer well-marked path takes hikers through unspoiled landscapes along the coast and inland from Asprokavos in the south to Agios Spiridon in the north. It's an ideal choice for avid hikers looking for a fulfilling holiday experience.
name: Corfu mountain trail

excerpt: Historic 19th-century mansion featuring animatronic figures as well as period interiors & objects.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Corfu's UNESCO-listed Old Town, Casa Parlante Museum is a captivating 19th-century mansion that offers visitors an immersive glimpse into the lives of a noble family from that era. This living history museum features lifelike animatronic figures representing three generations of a Corfiot family and their servants, all set against a backdrop of authentic period furnishings and artifacts.
name: Casa Parlante Museum

excerpt: Stately palace-turned-museum with an extensive collection of Chinese, Japanese & Indian artwork.
detail_description: Nestled within the elegant confines of a 19th-century British colonial palace, the Corfu Museum of Asian Art offers an extraordinary journey through Asia's rich artistic heritage. This stately museum showcases an impressive array of artifacts, including exquisite Chinese ceramics, intricate Japanese ukiyo-e prints, and captivating Indian sculptures. Visitors can marvel at stunning pieces like Ming pottery and jade carvings while exploring galleries that chronologically present these treasures.
name: Corfu Museum of Asian Art
address: Palace of St. Michael & George, Palea Anaktora 49100, Kerkira 491 00, Greece

detail_description: The Corfu Reading Society is a significant cultural institution in modern Greece, established in 1836. Housed in a grand cream-and-white villa, the society's library welcomes visitors to enjoy its collection of books. The museum is part of the rich intellectual life of the Ionian Islands and offers a glimpse into the area's historical and cultural heritage.
name: Corfu Reading Society

excerpt: Genteel, intimate restaurant with a terrace plating elevated local cuisine, plus a robust wine list.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Corfu Town, Venetian Well is a charming and intimate restaurant offering an elevated dining experience. The restaurant's location next to the historic Venetian well adds to its allure, creating a romantic and atmospheric setting. With a menu that combines local flavors with Mediterranean influences, guests can savor gourmet twists on island specialties while enjoying the picturesque surroundings of Kremasti Square.
name: Venetian Well

excerpt: Historic 16th-century fortified Venetian castle offering city & ocean views.
detail_description: The New Venetian Fortress, also known as the Samuels Fortress, is a historic 16th-century fortified castle that offers stunning views of the city and the ocean. It stands tall above Ohrid and Lake Ohrid, providing visitors with an unparalleled vantage point. Originally built in the late 16th century, this fortress is a well-preserved example of Venetian military architecture.
name: New Fortress

excerpt: Collection of Greek paper money & coins spanning 180 years, displayed in a 19th-century building.
detail_description: The Banknote Museum of the Ionian Bank, also known as the Numismatic Museum or the Paper Money Museum, is a unique attraction in Greece. Housed in a 19th-century building, it boasts an extensive collection of Greek paper money and coins spanning 180 years. The museum also showcases banknotes from different countries and periods, offering insight into the production process of modern nation's currency.
name: Banknote Museum of the Ionian Bank

excerpt: Notable religious artwork from the 15th to 20th century exhibited in a historic former church.
detail_description: The Byzantine Museum of Antivouniotissa is a unique museum located in the Church of Panaghia Antivouniotissa in Campiello quarter. The church, dating back to the 15th century, was transformed into a museum in 1979 through generous donations to the State. Inside, visitors can admire religious artwork spanning from the 15th to 20th century, including vintage wall frescoes, ancient manuscripts, and icons by renowned artists.
name: Byzantine Museum of Antivouniotissa

excerpt: Burial site of the national poet & a museum chronicling the lives & work of other local poets.
detail_description: The Museum of Dionysios Solomos is a tribute to the national poet of Greece, showcasing his personal belongings, manuscripts, and an extensive library in the house where he lived. The museum offers a comprehensive look at his life and influence on Greek and Italian revolutions. Additionally, it provides contemporary insights into the island's culture.
name: Museum of Dionysios Solomos

excerpt: French-style, 19th-century arcade bordering a landmark square, lined with upmarket cafes & eateries.
detail_description: Liston is a charming 19th-century arcade located alongside a famous square in Corfu. The arcade is reminiscent of French architecture and is home to a variety of upscale cafes and restaurants. It's an ideal spot for leisurely walks, enjoying a cup of coffee, or indulging in delicious local cuisine. Corfu's culinary scene boasts traditional dishes like pastitsada, sofrito, and bourdeto, making Liston a must-visit destination for food enthusiasts.
name: Liston

excerpt: Elegant 19th-century villa housing an archeological museum focusing on the area's artifacts.
detail_description: Museum of Palaiopolis - Mon Repos is an elegant 19th-century villa that has been repurposed into an archaeological museum, showcasing artifacts from the area. Originally built as the birthplace of Prince Phillip, it served various purposes over the years, including as a residence for British governors and a summer retreat for the Greek royal family. The villa is surrounded by enchanting English-style gardens that add to its picturesque setting.
name: Museum of Palaiopolis - Mon Repos

excerpt: Museum of the island's long past, with items from the Paleolithic era to Roman times.
detail_description: The Archaeological Museum of Corfu is a treasure trove of the island's history, showcasing artifacts from the Paleolithic era to Roman times. Housed in a 15th-century church, it features Byzantine carvings, icons, and items dating back to the 13th century. Originally focused on findings from the local Temple of Artemis, it expanded to include exhibits from the ancient citadel of Corfu.
name: Archaeological Museum of Corfu
address: Archeological Museum of Corfu, Vrela Armeni 1, Kerkira 491 00, Greece

name: Statue of Count Von Der Schulenburg

detail_description: The Museum of the Philharmonic Society of Corfu "Nikolaos Chalikiopoulos Mantzaros" is a must-visit attraction in Corfu. Visitors have praised the knowledgeable and kind staff who offer guided tours, providing insights into the island's musical history. The museum features an 1820 pianoforte on display, offering a glimpse into the music and events surrounding it. Additionally, visitors can enjoy a taste of Rose Liqueur during their tour.
name: Museum of the Philharmonic Society of Corfu "Nikolaos Chalikiopoulos Mantzaros"

detail_description: Ionian Seaways offers a seamless and enjoyable ferry experience between Corfu and Saranda. The staff at their office are incredibly helpful, providing assistance with ticketing and even offering cold water while waiting. They also offer luggage storage and helpful recommendations for nearby cafes. The ferry itself is clean, and the crossing is described as flawless, making for a delightful travel experience.
name: Ionian Seaways - Ferry Corfu Saranda

detail_description: ICON is a unique art gallery situated in Corfu, Greece, specializing in the creation of exquisite handmade artworks with religious and heraldic themes. This establishment showcases an impressive collection of meticulously crafted pieces that reflect both artistic brilliance and deep spiritual significance. With its location in the picturesque island of Corfu, the gallery beautifully captures the essence of Greek culture and heritage through these magnificent creations. The artworks on display at ICON are carefully designed to depict religious figures and symbols, as well as intricate heraldic emblems.
name: ICON

detail_description: The Corfu Gallery, located in the Old Town, is a haven for art enthusiasts. Showcasing an impressive collection of paintings and sculptures by Greek artists, the gallery offers a diverse display of human emotions and artistic styles. Visitors can immerse themselves in the various facets of life in Greece depicted through these captivating works of art. The gallery's opening hours may vary, but it is well worth a visit to experience contemporary Greek art at its finest.
name: Corfu Gallery

detail_description: The Bell Tower of the Annunziata Church is a beautiful building currently undergoing restoration, creating a wonderful atmosphere in Corfu town. It holds historical significance as the place where Miguel de Cervantes, the great Spanish writer, spent almost a year recovering from his injuries. Recently cleaned up, it offers a pleasant and quiet square with cafes to relax in the shade. Visitors can enjoy local musicians playing traditional songs while sipping coffee in this lovely picturesque place full of character and history.
name: Bell Tower of the Annunziata Church

detail_description: Casino Corfu is conveniently located just a short walk from Corfu Town, offering fabulous sea views from all rooms. The ground floor rooms feature a patio area with sunbeds, while the restaurant serves a superb self-service breakfast. Guests can enjoy friendly service and an extensive menu for half-board dining. The casino offers slot machines, roulette, and blackjack tables that open at 20:00 on the newly renovated second floor.
name: Casino Corfu

detail_description: The Holy Monastery of Platytera is a beautiful and romantic twin tower to the St. Spyridon cathedral in Corfu. It is known for its unique story of ducks brought by a monk to the monastery, adding to its charm. The monastery offers a peaceful and serene atmosphere, with a fantastic view of the Ionian Sea. Visitors can also explore the very old and beautiful church on the grounds, which houses the tomb of Ioannis Kapodistrias, the first Governor of Greece.
name: Holy Monastery of Platytera

detail_description: The Lighthouse of the Old Fortress in Corfu Old Town offers splendid and secluded vistas, with limited crowds during the early hours. Initially, there are a few displays to explore before venturing further towards the lighthouse courtyard. The primary allure lies in its breathtaking panoramas rather than its informational content. It serves as a convenient vantage point for surveying past or future destinations.
name: Old Fortress Lighthouse
Statue of Georgios Theotokis
address: Πλ. Ηρ. Κυπριακού Αγώνα, Kerkira 491 00, Greece

name: Latin Chapel of Madonna of the Karmelitae
Statue of Sir Frederick Adam by Pavlos Prosalentis

detail_description: The Palace of Saints Michael and George in Corfu is home to the Municipal Art Gallery, a remarkable museum located in its east wing. This gallery showcases artwork by 19th-century painters from Corfu and the Heptanese School, which acts as a connection between Byzantine tradition and modern Greek art. The exhibitions also feature temporary displays of contemporary works by Greek artists.
name: Corfu Art Gallery

detail_description: Faliraki Bathing Beach is a popular spot in the city center, easily accessible and free of charge. It offers a small strip of sand with views of the Old Fortress and several bars and restaurants. Locals and visitors frequent this beach for its relaxed atmosphere. While entrance to the sea can be uncomfortable without proper shoes, it provides clear waters for swimming. Snorkeling is outstanding, especially towards the Old Fortress.
name: Faliraki Bathing Beach

detail_description: Ionian Parliament Square is a spacious and attractive area in Corfu, known for its beauty. It's considered one of the most beautiful parts of the city and pays tribute to Saint Spiridon. While some visitors feel it could be cleaner, many appreciate its handsome and very nice ambiance.
name: Ionian Parliament Square
